description: Sociable numbers: smallest member of each cycle.
comments: Numbers belonging to aliquot cycles of length greater than 2.The lengths of the corresponding aliquot cycles are given by A052470. - _Michel Marcus_, Nov 15 2013
references: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems Number Theory, B7.
P. Poulet, Parfaits, amiables et extensions, Editions Stevens, Bruxelles, 1918.
D. Wells, The Penguin Dictionary of Curious and Interesting Numbers, pp. 174 Penguin Books 1987.
links: Jeppe Stig Nielsen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..53
INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 112
D. Moews, Perfect, amicable and sociable numbers
J. O. M. Pedersen, Tables of Aliquot Cycles
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sociable Numbers.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Incorrect g.f. deleted by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 20 2008
